intro: Dicliptera hensii, commonly known as Hensii dicliptera, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the grass family, Poaceae, and is characterized by its tufted growth habit and narrow leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in dense clusters, which are typically wind-pollinated. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands or along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and landscapes.
